overview_of_class: This course covers the knowledge and skills required to select, fit, adjust, and validate hearing aids.  In the first half of the class, we review hearing aid technology and the decisions based on that technology.  In the second half of the class, we consider fitting and adjustment of the hearing aid.
name: Evaluation and Use of Amplification Systems
title: SoC CSD 411-0-20 Evaluation and Use of Amplification Systems

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course covers the knowledge and skills required to select, fit, adjust, and validate hearing aids. In the first half of the class, we review hearing aid technology and the decisions based on that technology. In the second half of the class, we consider fitting and adjustment of the hearing aid.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value:
At the conclusion of this course, the student will be able to:
1. Describe hearing aid types, component parts and systems
2. Describe and conduct measures of hearing aid electroacoustic performance
3. Describe hearing aid candidacy in children and adults
4. Describe hearing aid fitting considerations in children and adults
5. Describe how to evaluate hearing aid benefit
6. Describe factors to consider in counseling new hearing aid wearers.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Each section includes content (readings, lectures) and hands-on skills (labs).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Taylor and Mueller, Fitting and Dispensing Hearing Aids and selected articles.
